deck: Dr. Vincent Morrow is a doctor who specialises in supernatural medicine. He strives to cure patients of such ails like vampirism and possession.
name: Vincent Morrow

deck: Fatanyeros was Europe's single most important chefs, if not the world's.
description:
Origin

Born a mute Fatanyeros could only communicate through what he could cook. He could transfer great writing such as Shakespeare and music like that of Verdi into his food for all to enjoy.

Major Story Arcs

International Flavor

Fatanyeros is taken captive with other chefs by Nomi Haupai, the Governor of the Pacific Island of Yamapalu. The governor needed his excellent talents to make his Islands new food source a major success internationally. Fatanyeros knew that people back in Europe were coming back for him and prepared a dish for Nomi, the governor, to let him know that he knew who would save him by the fact that information was shared about the rising body count on the island. This made the Governor worried so he went to see Fatanyero but when he got there the 'Vampire' was rescuing Fatanyeros. Tony Chew broke in to save Fatanyeros but was attacked while confronting the "Vampire" by the Governor. This allowed The two of them to leave. While on the Flight back to Europe Fatanyeros is attacked by his savior who had planned on killing him to gain his talents from the begging.

Abilities

Cibolocutor: able to communicate through cooking."
name: Fatanyeros

deck: Dante is one of the Furies and represents the vengeance of the oppressed.
description:
Origin

Faith Jacobs was a cop who accidently stumbled upon a crime scene. One of the three women who were murdered, reached out to Faith and transferred her powers to an unsuspecting Faith. The three bodies were the former hosts of the Furies, all murdered by Anthony Valente and his henchmen. Faith Jacobs became possessed by Dante. It is rumored that Zeus created the original Furies thousands of years ago.

Creation

Dante was created by William A. Christensen and Mark Seifert.
name: Dante

deck: Epiphany is one of the Furies and represents the oracle of evil deeds.
description:
Origin

Amy Kozlowski was a medical examiner who investigated the three bodies found by Faith Jacobs. One of the three bodies reached out to Amy and transferred her powers to her. The three bodies were the former hosts of the Furies, all murdered by Anthony Valente and his henchmen. Amy Kozlowski became possessed by Epiphany. It is rumored that Zeus created the original Furies thousands of years ago.

Creation

Epiphany was created by William A. Christensen and Mark Seifert.
name: Epiphany

deck: Silhouette is one of the Furies and represents the seeker of evil. It is rumored that Zeus created the original Furies thousands of years ago.
description:
Origin

Sarah Mosley was the girlfriend of local crimeboss Anthony Valente. She heard him say to his henchmen that he had rounded up 'the girls'. Suspecting him to have an affair, she followed him. Instead of him having an affair, she witnessed the murder of the hosts of the Furies. After Valente and his men had left, Sarah crouched beside one of the bodies. The dying woman reached out to Sarah and transferred her power to her. Sarah Mosley became possessed by Silhouette.

Ever since she got her powers, she has been searching for her missing younger sister, Penny.

Creation

Epiphany was created by William A. Christensen and Mark Seifert.
name: Silhouette

deck: Former crimeboss who was resurrected by his crimelord Fractur after being killed by his girlfriend.
name: Fuse

deck: Charlie "Big Time" Bigelow. He was Terry's best friend when they were street thugs and has since become one of Terry's worst enemies since Terry became Batman and Charlie became Big Time.
description:
Origin

Terry tried to get Bruce to give Charlie a second chance, giving him a security job in a Wayne/Powers warehouse, Charlie took advantage of his 2nd chance, but not in the way Terry had hoped, and instead set up a robbery, During the robbery that Terry stopped as Batman, Charlie was exposed to a mutagenic compound and was transformed into "Big Time". Terry later was fooled by Big Time into thinking he wanted to be cured, but soon discovered Charlie was lieing and preferred his new mutated form. Terry as Batman defeats his former friend, and Bruce attempts to console Terry by telling his about Harvey Dent.

Big Time returns to Gotham and is working for a small time hood called the Major who has aspirations to become the crime lord of Gotham. Big Time convinces Terry that he wants to go clean and is willing to work with the police to bring down the Major in exchange for a cure to his condition. Big Time is actually using Terry to get the Major arrested so he can take over the Major's crew.

Big Time's plan works but Terry is a loose end. Big Time tries to kill Terry but Bruce followed Terry and knocked out Big Time with his reinforced limo. Terry jumps into his bat suit and fights Big Time on the Kane Bridge. Their struggle causes the both of them to fall off the Kane Bridge. Terry grabs Big Time by the hand but his massive body is too heavy for Terry to hold. Terry looses his grip and Big Time falls to his supposed death.

Big Time was presumed dead after falling off the Kane bridge. It turns out Big Time survived his fall and was placed in the newly designed Arkham Asylum since the original asylum was left to rot like an open wound. Big Time was present when the mayor of Gotham paid a visit to the asylum and suffered from what seems like a normal cardiac arrest.

After a 34 year absence, Pat Mills returned to the Visible Man character with a one-off story in Prog 1771 - this story introduced the Visible Woman.

The character returned again for one-off story 'Scars' in the annual Prog 2013.
name: Visible Woman

deck: P'Nigh is a loyal adviser in Za's palace.
description:
Origin

P'Nigh is an intelligent, charismatic floating head. His origins and how he ended up on Cammera are all a mystery.

Creation

P'Nigh is the creation of Kevin Maguire. He first appeared in Weird Worlds #5 during Maguire's storyline involving another one of his creations, Tanga.

Major Story Arcs

Weird Worlds

P'Nigh lived in the fortress of Za as his trusted adviser. When Tanga appeared at the fortress and asked to see Za, P'Nigh was the one that greeted and accompanied her.

My Greatest Adventure

P'Nigh reappeared in My Greatest Adventure, which is a continuation of the story-line from Weird Worlds. Tanga returned to the Fortress of Za to once again be greeted by P'Nigh. While Tanga and Za both react to each other with anger, P'Nigh remained the unemotional companion of Za and he insisted on restraint when the pair of them wanted to fight.

Tanga and Za met up again in response to another monster attack. The pair fought each other and Tanga prevailed. After Tanga dealt with Za, she traveled back to the fortress to confront P'Nigh and Fialla.

Buck Ranger is a western hero.

Creation

name: Buck Ranger

deck: Father is the architect of Weapon Infinity.  He is also responsible for seeding the Deathlok wave in all realities to capture the World and kill Fantomex.
description:
Origin

During the Cold War, Weapon Plus created operation code name Descendant with the purpose of recreating and android as sophisticated as Jim Hammond, the Human Torch. Three individuals known only as Father, Mother and Brother attempted to create the perfect android. Though they came close they were never able to replicate "true life" until Brother, who was a scientist of magic, used the Orb of Necromancy to breathe life into their creations. Twenty Descendants, Homo-Synthezoids, were created. Father demanded Brother to repeat the process on a mass scale to which he refused and later disappeared with the Orb. Mother released the Descendants into the world to live unaware of their true power.

Father continues to create variations of the Descendants, each with it's own flaw without the help of Brother's Orb. Father created the adaptoids in order to find and recover the Descendants.

Father has seen a future where super humans went too far and had to be stopped. He created Operation Deathlok wherein all super humans were killed, reanimated and converted into Deathloks. Apocalypse's existence in the current time threatens his future so he has seeded the Deathloks into all dimensions and realities to kill Fantomex.

Creation

Father was created by Rick Remender and first appeared in Uncanny X-Force #6.

Character Evolution

Major Story Arcs

Deathlok Nation

For further information: Uncanny X-Force

Fantomex discovers that someone has been controlling the World in his absence and has let time and evolution to elapse for almost a million years. Father is revealed to be responsible for this as well as Weapon Infinity. Fantomex alerts X-Force to the threat of the Deathloks as they travel into the world to kill Father, which would stop this all from happening. Deadpool is the one to find Father in the World in his lair. As he approaches him, he seems to recognize his voice and immediately wishes to please him and seek his approval. Deadpool watches along with Father as the Deathloks almost kill Wolverine and Fantomex. Father commands Deadpool to finish the job before Wade is able to overcome his control and beheads Father, ending the wave of Deathloks.

The Descendants

For further information: Secret Avengers

Father is revealed to still be alive despite his beheading and is currently leading the cabal of robots in the Core. He seemingly kills the descendant Yalda only to reprogram her later. The Secret Avengers attempt to save Yalda and her son Parvez but lose Eric O'Grady on the process. Father sends a robot in O'Grady's guise as a double agent. The Secret Avengers escape with Parvez but Father and his cabal survive.

issue_credits.name: A Victory for the Little Guy

name: Father

volume_credits.name: Uncanny X-Force by Rick Remender Omnibus

deck: Batman of the 46th Century.
description:
If you were referring to the original Batman : Batman

Origin

Batman is the disembodied consciousness of a future Batman whose mind had been uploaded into the Batcave computers before he died. He continues to fight crime after his death, by remotely animating an intangible holographic form that is covered in flat, bat-shaped robotic probes. He uses this costume of smart fabric bats to accomplish many tasks such as attacking his enemies and scouting out surrounding areas.

The Unknown Superman is his ally and together they have fought against the Greater Darkness and the Lord of Time.

Current Events

Batsman hasn't appeared since his feature debut, but is recognized still for being an alternate/future version of Batman.

Powers & Abilities

Batsman has almost all the original abilities of Batman (Bruce Wayne), but the addition of a more advanced and specialized Bat-Suit, and can phase through walls. He is also an expert in many forms of martial arts.
name: Batsman

aliases:
Heart of Darkness
The Darkness
Deceptigod
deck: The Personification of the Dead universe, the D-Void desires to travel into the universe home to the Transformers which would then cause both universes to fuse together and destroy everything.
description:
Major Story Arcs

Heart of Darkness

D-Void called the entire population of Gorlam Prime to the Dead Universe , where it then fed off of every last being so it could awaken. When Galvatron arrives on Gorlam Prime with the Heart of Darkness, he enters the Dead Universe and D-Void attempts to feed on his unique energy but Galvatron manages to fight it off. D-Void then resurrects Nemesis Prime in the Dead Universe and sends him after Galvatron when he arrives on Dykayra. Although Galvatron and his forces overpower Nemesis Prime at first, a figment of D-Void then possesses Nemesis Prime and he then feeds off of the energy of Galvatron’s forces to grow stronger. Galvatron then battles the D-Void possessed Nemesis Prime, but he is overpowered. Just as D-Void is about to finish off Galvatron, the rest of Galvatron’s forces arrive and they drive it back into the trans-dimensional gateway it came from and Galvatron then blasts the portal, destroying it.

Chaos

D-Void ticked Galvatron into bringing the Heart of Darkness inside Cybertron. Galvatron was under the belief that the Heart of Darkness would destroy Cybertron and prevent the Expansion of the Dead Universe. He thought he was saving Cybertron when in fact he was aiding in its destruction. When the Autobots interfered, the D-Void reached out through the Heart of Darkness and took control of Galvatron's army along with the Decepticons present, who were the most susceptible to its mind control. It combined them into a creature called the "Deceptigod" and attacked the Autobots. Megatron was able to resist D-Void's control and destroyed the Deceptigod with his Canon. Optimus Prime went after Galvatron who was headed to Vector Sigma with the aim of throwing the Heart of Darkness into the primal wellspring. Unfortunately Optimus arrived too late and Galvatron turned Vector Sigma into a portal through which the D-Void began to emerge. D-Void was ultimately stopped when Optimus Prime sacrificed himself by diving into Vector Sigma and used the Matrix of Leadership to defeat it, causing the "reboot" of Cybertron.
name: D-Void

deck: A Dutchman and a professional detective and hitman. He was one of the suspected hired hitman to kill off Deadpool
description:
Brief history

Van Burian was first seen when he found DNA samples coming from Deadpool. This made it possible to make a toxic witch disabled Deadpool's healing power, effectively making him vulnerable again. Van Burian was on X-force's list of suspects for almost shooting Deadpool with the toxic, but when the team of mutants went to his hideout, Van Burian was already killed by Typoid Mary and her Hand followers. 
 
Trivia: Whether Van Burian has anything to do with Rich van Burian, better known as Sniper, whom happens to be an assassin for hire as well, remains to be seen.
name: Van Burian

deck: King of the Northern Ice Trolls
description:
Guttlekraw is the King of the Mountain Trolls, who overtake and enslave the original Trolls, led by Greymung. He is featured in the Original elfquest (1978) and is overthrown by Picknose in EQ #19.

Long ago, many trolls lived together in peace in the northlands of the world of two moons. For many generations, the trolls had a space undisturbed where they could dig roots, grow mushrooms, and mine for precious jewels and ore to forge.But a climatic shift made their planet colder and colder, and the trolls were faced with the onset of an Ice-Age. Glaciers advanced into their lands and gradually forced the trolls south. The frigid climate eventually created too much hardship for the hungry trolls, and Greymung split his family away from the trolls of the icelands, and led them into the forest.

While the cavetrolls of the forestlands had found a welcoming land of plenty, the cavetrolls of the icelands grew increasingly bitter, and eventually ambushed Greymung and enslaved the trolls who broke apart.

In elfquest, Greymung is the leader of the ice trolls who are at odds with the Go-Backs, led by Kahvi.

Guttlekraw stands in the way of all that the combined forces of Lord Voll, the Go-Backs, and the Wolfriders long for. His troll forces were tougher than usual elves, and only with the help of two-edge, did the elves manage to defeat Guttlekraw. Thus, he is the anti-thesis of all that the Palace of the High Ones represents to the elves.
name: Guttlekraw

Origin

Sylvester Cole is an enemy of the original Firebrand.  He worked for Baron Van Hanson, a jewel smuggler and thief.

deck: Baron Von Hanson is an enemy of the original Firebrand.
description:
Origin

Baron Von Hanson is an enemy of the original Firebrand.  His name is actually an alias he uses to smuggle jewels he steals.  He was caught by the original Firebrand and forced to give all his diamonds to a war victims charity.
name: Baron Von Hanson

deck: Jake Horn is a weak minded criminal and friend to Daniel Dyce, also known as 711.
description:
Origin

Jake Horn is a weak minded criminal and friend to Daniel Dyce, also known as 711.  Before Daniel became 711 he was a promising district attorney.  Jake had however gotten in trouble with the law and was facing a life sentence.  He then somehow convinces his friend to take the rap  for him as they looked alike.  Daniel agrees to do it on the condition that he turns himself in when his child is born.  We will never know if Jake would have kept that promise because on the day of his childs birth he is hit by a car and killed.  Leaving Daniel in prison for life and thus 711 is created.
name: Jake Horn

volume_credits.name: Judge Dredd The Complete Case Files

deck: Resident of Mega-City One.
description:
Mrs Gunderson is a Mega-City One resident and appears in the 2000AD and Megazine world of Judge Dredd.

Resident of Apartment 133b and one-time landlady to a Mr Jay De'ath (or Judge Death as he is really know), Mrs Gunderson is nearly blind and doesn't know who her lodger really is, a fact which spares her life.

When Death is later recaptured, Mrs Gunderson is sent in to his containment unit so the Judges can find out why she was never originally killed by the Dark Judge. Still blissfully unaware of who her ex-tenant is, Death possesses and threatens to kill her, but the Mega-City Judges call his bluff. Unable to take her life, Death declares her innocent, leaves her body and returns to his containment prison. Mrs G returns, alive, to her boarding house.

Occassionally turning up in 2000AD and the Megazine, Mrs Gunderson still manages to get herself into all sorts of scrapes with perps and criminals, blissfully unaware of what is going on around her.
name: Mrs Gunderson

volume_credits.name: Judge Dredd: The Henry Flint Collection

deck: Hack writer in Mega-City One
description:
Brian Skuter appears in the Judge Dredd story - Boyhood of a Superfiend.

Lands the scoop of a lifetime after receiving a call from Judge Death himself (who is in hiding after Necropolis).

Brian gets the story of Judge Death's early life, but pays with his own.

John Wagner also used the alias 'Brian Skuter' when writing the story.
name: Brian Skuter

deck: Villain of the Teen Titans.
description:
Origin

The teenager who later became Grymm was once a member of the US military, then one day him and his unit were volunteered for some experiments. They all received Meta-powers, but Grymm was the only one to survive the testing and was now able to control peoples body with a paralytic toxin he generates from his skin. He later broke out of the lab and went on a criminal spree, until S.T.A.R. Labs stopped him and locked him up.

Creation

Grymm was created by Scott Lobdell and Brett Booth for there series Teen Titans

Major Story Arcs

Teen Titans: It's Our Right to Fight

For more information see: Teen Titans: It's Our Right to Fight

After a battle with Superboy, the Teen Titans are forced to take Kid Flash to S.T.A.R. Labs for medical attention from Static. While there Grymm, who is being held two floors up in a padded holding cell, hears the Titan's thoughts and hatches a plan for escape. Grymm then reaches out to the Titan's minds and after realizing Wonder Girl's mind was too stubborn and Bunker's was too happy, he feels Skitter's mind is perfect. He takes control of her and uses her to escape his cell. When Wonder Girl and Bunker come looking for their friend Grymm gets the jump on thern. He then tries to control their bodies but Bunker's power comes from his mind and he is able to blind side Gyrmm. Defeated it is assumed that Grymm is put back in his cell.

Powers and Abilities

Grymm is a Metahuman with the ability to channel emotions such as rage and use them as attacks. He is also capable of controlling people's bodies, but not their minds.

issue_credits.name: Be Careful What You Wish For
And Now... The End is Near; Home Sweet Home

issues_died_in.name: And Now... The End is Near; Home Sweet Home

name: Grymm

volume_credits.name: Teen Titans: It's Our Right to Fight
